original_title: « J'irai cracher sur vos tombes » : rage, sexe et jazz
overview: In 1946, the controversial French writer Boris Vian writes his novel I Spit on Your Graves under the pseudonym of Vernon Sullivan, supposedly a mysterious African-American writer; a work against racism and Anglo-Saxon puritanism whose publication causes a great scandal.
title: Rage, Sex, and Jazz: I Spit on Your Graves by Vernon Sullivan
